div.stage: Enter Mr. and MRS. GREEN JONES, L.—she with shawl and bonnet, he with his basket and the guitar.

sp.speaker: Green.
sp.p: There's only one set left: perhaps Providence has sent a customer. Trotters, mum? (to MRS. WILLOUGHBY)

sp.speaker: Emily.
sp.p: (L. C., stopping him) In my company! I'm surprised at you! conceal that basket. (advancing to MRS. WILLOUGHBY) Why, if it isn't Mrs. Willoughby and Sam! Why, don't you know us the St. Evremonds?

sp.speaker: Mrs. W.
sp.p: (R. C.) Lor bless me and so it is! and that dear, blessed man that suffered so in his shins—which perseverance is its own reward; and may I ask what Mr. Jones

sp.speaker: Emily.
sp.p: Mr. St. Evremond.

sp.speaker: Mrs. W.
sp.p: Mr. St. Evremond—what's he a doin'?

sp.speaker: Emily.
sp.p: He's in business.

sp.speaker: Green.
sp.p: Yes, as a (producing basket)

sp.speaker: Emily.
sp.p: (getting between Mrs. WILLOUGHBY and the basket) As a sort of a sheep farmer. But whatever are you doing here at this time of night?

sp.speaker: Mrs. W.
sp.p: Oh, my dear, it's a long story and if you wears pockets, mend 'em, is my advice—which, whether they dropped, or whether they was picked—

sp.speaker: Sam.
sp.p: (impatiently) We can't get in—Granny's lost her keys.

sp.speaker: Emily.
sp.p: And you haven't a latch? Well, I wouldn't have thought it of you. Where did she lose them?

sp.speaker: Sam.
sp.p: At the Bridgewater Arms—and the house is shut up now.

sp.speaker: Emily.
sp.p: I'm engaged there; I don't mind knocking Maltby up—I rather like it. Come along, Jones, it's only a step; (aside to him) conceal that basket!

div.stage: Exeunt EMILY, SAM, and MRS. WILLOUGHBY, L. 12.

sp.speaker: Green.
sp.p: Emily thinks trotters low; she don't see that even the trotter trade may be elevated by politeness and attention to seasoning.

div.stage: Exit, L. 1 E.
Enter DALTON, MOSS, and BRIERLY, R.

sp.speaker: Dalton.
sp.p: Come along, Bob. All serene. (aside) Where could he have got that six-shooter from? However, I nailed the caps in the cab. Moss, you be crow—two whistles if the coast ain't clear—we'll work the crib. Lucky I nailed the old woman's keys. They'll save tools and time. Give me the glim. (MOSS takes out small lanthorn and gives it to him) Now, my lad, (to BRIERLY) take care; I'm a man of few words. The pal who sticks by me, I stick by him, till death. But the man who tries to double on me, had better have the hangman looking after him, than Jem Dalton.

div.stage: Exeunt DALTON, BRIERLY and MOSS, L.
Enter HAWKSHAW, R.

sp.speaker: Hawk.
sp.p: This should be Crampton's beat. (gives a peculiar whistle, and enter a DETECTIVE, R. 1 E.) Take the fastest Hansom you can find; tear down with this to Peckham. (gives note) Bring the old gent back to St. Nicholas Lane. Say he'll be wanted to make a charge. There's a crib to be jumped. I'm down on 'em. By the bye, lend me your barker. (DETECTIVE gives him a pistol, and exit, R. 1 E.) Jem Dalton's a tough customer. I always feel rather ashamed to burn powder. Any fool can blow a man's brains out. (tries caps and charges) So that lad's true blue after all. I had no idea that he tumbled to their game. He managed that letter uncommonly neat. Now for St. Nicholas Churchyard. When Jem Dalton planted his tools he never thought they'd come up darbies.

div.stage: Exit L.
Enter MAY, breathless, R.

sp.p: I've followed the cab as far as I could. I saw them get out, and lost them at the last turning. If I could only keep them in sight—if he could but hear my voice— Robert! Robert!

div.stage: Exit, L

div.head: SCENE THIRD—The Churchyard of St. Nicholas with tombstones and neglected trees; wall at back, L. C.; up, side of stage.
div.stage: L. an iron railing supposed to separate the churchyard from the street; in flat, R. C., the wall of Mr. Gibson's office, with practicable back door)
DALTON and BRIERLY drop over the wall, L. C, followed by MOSS.

sp.speaker: Dalton.
sp.p: Now to transplant the tools! (gets tools from behind tombstone) All right. Moss, look alive! Here's the door and the keys.

div.stage: Exit into office by back door, R. C., followed by BRIERLY.

sp.speaker: Moss.
sp.p: (on the look out) Nice quiet place—I like working in the city; I wish everybody lived out of town, and left their premises in charge of their housekeepers. (MAY is heard, L., singing the refrain of her song) What's that? That girl! She must have followed us. Here she is.

div.stage: Enter MAY in the street, L.

sp.speaker: May.
sp.p: (sees MOSS) Oh, sir, you were with him! where is he?

sp.speaker: Moss.
sp.p: I'm just taking a little walk in my garden before retiring for the night; they've gone on to the Cave of Harmony—first turn on the left; there's a red lamp over the door, you can't miss it.

div.stage: Exit, L. 2 E.

sp.speaker: May.
sp.p: Oh, thank you—thank you!

sp.speaker: Moss.
sp.p: That's neat! Trust old Moss when anybody's to be made safe.

div.stage: (HAWKSHAW during the above has dropped over wall at the back, seizes MOSS from behind, stops his mouth with one hand, and handcuffs him, R.)

sp.p: Stir or speak, and you're a dead man!

sp.speaker: Dalton.
sp.p: (appearing at back door) Hang the cloud! I can't see. Moss!

sp.speaker: Hawk.
sp.p: (imitating) All serene!

sp.speaker: Dalton.
sp.p: (coming down) We've done the job. (calling to BRIERLY) Now, the box.

sp.speaker: Brier.
sp.p: (within) I'll bring it. (comes from door with cash box)

sp.speaker: Dalton.
sp.p: We'll share at the Pigeons in Duck Lane. The box! quick!

sp.speaker: Brier.
sp.p: A word or two first.

sp.speaker: Dalton.
sp.p: We can talk in the cab.

sp.speaker: Brier.
sp.p: No, here. You were my ruin four years ago.

sp.speaker: Dalton.
sp.p: I've paid you back to-night twice over. Come —the box!

sp.speaker: Brier.
sp.p: I suffered then for your crime. Ever since you've come between me and honest life—you've broke me down—you've brought me to this.

sp.speaker: Dalton.
sp.p: I suppose you mean you've a right to an extra share of the swag?

sp.speaker: Brier.
sp.p: No, I mean that you're my prisoner, or you're a dead man! (seizes him and presents pistol)

sp.speaker: Dalton.
sp.p: Hands off, you fool!

sp.speaker: Brier.
sp.p: Nay then (snaps pistol)

sp.speaker: Dalton.
sp.p: You should have asked me for the caps. Here they are. (holds them up)

sp.speaker: Brier.
sp.p: No matter; armed or unarmed, you don't escape me.

div.stage:
(a struggle—DALTON strikes down BRIERLY, as
HAWKSHAW rushes from his concealment, R.)

sp.speaker: Hawk.
sp.p: Now, Jem Dalton! It's my turn!

sp.speaker: Dalton.
sp.p: Hawkshaw! (they struggle; HAWKSHAW is forced down on a tombstone and nearly strangled; SAM appears outside the rails, L., springs over them, seizes DALTON by the legs and throws him over; HAWKSHAW rises and puts the handcuffs on DALTON; MAY appears in the street, L.)

sp.speaker: May.
sp.p: Robert! Husband!

sp.speaker: Sam.
sp.p: (over DALTON) Lie still, will you? You're a nice young man! (crossing to R., looking over MOSS) You're a pair of nice young men!

sp.speaker: Hawk.
sp.p: Now Jem Dalton! remember poor Joe Skirrett—I promised him I'd do it. I've done it at last.

div.stage: Enter MR. GIBSON from back door of house, followed by MAY, who has gone round.

sp.speaker: Gibson.
sp.p: This way! Here they are! The safe open! The cash-box gone?

sp.speaker: Hawk.
sp.p: No, saved. (gives it to him)

sp.speaker: Gibson.
sp.p: By whom?

sp.speaker: Hawk.
sp.p: The man who is bleeding yonder, Robert Brierly.

sp.speaker: May.
sp.p: My husband, wounded! Oh mercy! (she kneels over him)

sp.speaker: Gibson.
sp.p: Thank heaven, he's not dead. I can repay him yet.

sp.speaker: Hawk.
sp.p: Men don't die so easily. He's worth a dozen dead men.

sp.speaker: May.
sp.p: Look, he opens his eyes. Robert, speak to me, It's May your own wife.

sp.speaker: Brier.
sp.p: (faintly) Darling, I'm glad you're here. It's only a clip of the head. I'm none the worse. It was all my game, to snare these villains. Who's there? Mr. Gibson? You wouldn't trust me, sir; but I was not ungrateful. You see, there may be some good left in a "TICKET-OF LEAVE-MAN," after all! (tableau)

div.stage: HAWK. MAY. BRIER. GIBSON. MOSS. DALTON. OFFICERS. SAM.
